keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: The number of Air Force personnel at Lajes Field, once a significant transit hub in the Atlantic, is expected to drop to 165 from 650 as part of broader cuts.

headline.print_headline: Worry in Azores as Americans Start to Leave
headline.main: Americans Start to Leave Air Base in Azores, and Locals Fear Economic Impact

snippet: The number of Air Force personnel at Lajes Field, once a significant transit hub in the Atlantic, is expected to drop to 165 from 650 as part of broader cuts.
abstract: Lajes Journal; Air Force downsizing plans include reducing military and civilian personnel at Lajes Field air base on Portugal's Terceira Island in Atlantic's Azores archipelago, strategic location for stopovers experiencing declining use due to fuel efficient planes and in-flight fueling; proposal is expected to save American military $35 million per year but has Portuguese residents and local politicians fearing adverse economic and social implications.
